message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.SI 

This paper discusses a self-organizing map (SOM), which is a type of artificial neural network. The paper focuses on the practical concern of the inherent randomness of SOMs, which can produce dissimilar patterns even when trained on identical samples. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category, which deals with artificial neural networks and their applications. Additionally, the paper proposes a deterministic approach to SOMs, which could also place it in the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The paper also applies the proposed approach to satellite data for cloud type classification, which suggests that it could belong to the Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV) sub-category. The use of artificial neural networks and machine learning techniques for data analysis and classification also suggests that the paper could belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a new approach to SOMs, which could be considered a form of computational intelligence, placing it in the Soft Computing (cs.SI) sub-category.
